intro: Canthium ellipticum, commonly known as the elliptic spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with elliptical, waxy leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a unique structure that includes both stamens and pistils. Canthium ellipticum is adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or scrubland habitats.
